intro: Onosma viridis, commonly known as greenweed, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine pubescence. Onosma viridis is sometimes used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
